alert.note: Alert for Allegan (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 9:28PM EDT until April 08 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Kalamazoo River at New Richmond affecting Allegan County. .Heavy rain that fell over the past 36 hours continues to flow from tributaries into the Kalamazoo River. Generally dry weather is expected during the next week. For the Kalamazoo River..has.including Marshall, Battle Creek, Comstock, New Richmond...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kalamazoo River at New Richmond. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of low lying areas and farmland along the river. Boardwalk along the river and boat launch would be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 17.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.3 feet on 06/29/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
